pageContext.claim: “We had a surplus with Mexico and Canada, and we went to $130 billion trade deficit with the combination of Mexico and Canada.”
pageContext.analysis: In 2017, the U.S. had a $63.6 billion trade deficit with Mexico, but it had a $8.4 billion trade surplus with Canada. Combining the two, as Trump suggests, equals a $55.2 billion trade deficit. The president regularly only considers the goods, ignoring services. Calculated that way, the combined deficit was $88.1 billion — not $130.
